title: Opinion | Is the Threat of Impeachment Emboldening Trump?
text:
Listen and subscribe to our podcast from your mobile device:

Apple Podcasts | Spotify | Google Play | RadioPublic | Stitcher

Is the threat of impeachment making President Trump more erratic — and more dangerous? With Michelle Goldberg out on assignment, fellow Op-Ed columnist Jamelle Bouie returns to “The Argument” to discuss Trump’s decision to withdraw American troops from Syria and his defiance in the face of Democrats’ impeachment inquiry. The Syria decision was particularly ill advised because it alienated Republican lawmakers and elements of the president’s base at a critical time, argues Ross Douthat. Jamelle thinks Trump’s behavior is likely to become increasingly volatile as public support for impeachment grows. And David Leonhardt wants to see more ex-administration officials speak out against their former boss’s chaotic moves.

Then, with the conservative-leaning Supreme Court back in session and a slew of big cases on the docket, the columnists debate whether Democrats should answer Republicans’ constitutional hardball with their own.

And finally, as a movie set in the dark and gritty New York of the 1980s dominates the box office, Jamelle recommends a star-studded, similarly set film made closer to the era it depicts.
description: And should Democrats pack the Supreme Court?
